p: The burden of dengue fever is high; around half of the world population is estimated to be at risk of infection [ 14] and every year, ~â€‰100 million symptomatic cases are detected [ 14, 15]. This poses a significant burden to the health systems in at least 128 countries worldwide [ 15] as well as economic impacts [ 16] that likely will expand to new regions in the future [ 3, 8, 17]. In Brazil, dengue was re-introduced in 1986 in the state of Roraima [ 18, 19] and quickly spread to the rest of the country [ 13]. In 2018, the total number of cases reported in Brazil was 265,934 [ 20] and so far 1,439,471 cases have been reported in 2019 through August [ 21].
